Text.Value: No hurt Scratch! Never!

EditorData.NodeContext: Horrified at the thought. (Sentence fragments intentional for the cub)

Text.Value: Did you call me master just now...?
Did you call me mistress just now...?
Did you call me guardian just now...?
*Scratch's tail wags furiously. These two have become firm friends.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: <ChadD> [Player] pets both animals on the head at the same time.

Text.Value: Leave.

EditorData.AnimationTags: <ChadD> After a moment [Player] hears a sudden loud screech behind them, they turn around
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The loud shriek of the owlbear cub is suddenly heard, a short distance away in the darkness, followed by the soft whine of Scratch (both offscreen). The player turns and looks at the darkness in surprise/alarrm

Text.Value: *Bark!*
Pet Scratch.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This node if the player hasn't petted Scratch before (comapnion approval)

Text.Value: *Scratch looks at you in confusion. His tail wags enthusiastically, nonetheless.*
He's still young. I remember Gomwick would let me sleep under his cloak when I was a pup. It helps.
You two looked cozy together. Bad dreams aside.
Call to them.
Goblins had me in a cage. Poked me with pointy sticks..

EditorData.NodeContext: A little shaken. Still lingering on the dream he was having. (Sentence fragments intentional for the cub)

Text.Value: Like it here. Warm fire, Scratch reminds me of big brother.

EditorData.NodeContext: Content. (Sentence fragments intentional for the cub)

EditorData.stateContext: Player is in the corner of the campsite, away from tents and campfire.Scratch and the owlbear cub are lying down together, Cub is asleep and dreaming. Scratch is awake.

Text.Value: Easy now. The guardian's just looking out for us.
Leave it. Those animals aren't your concern.
What's going on? I thought something was wrong.
Pet Scratch.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This node if the player has petted Scratch before (no companion approval)

Text.Value: Just a bad dream. It's all right.

EditorData.AnimationTags: <ChadD> [Player] kneels down to talk to the two animals.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Scratch spots the player and stands, wagging his tail. The owlbear cub blinks awake and gets up.

Text.Value: Observe the pair for any signs of injury.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Cannot be jumped/aliased due to diffferent state from earlier version

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player moves towards the violent-sounding animal noises, coming from off-screen.

Text.Value: *The sounds stop. Whatever just happened, it's too late to intervene now.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: <ChadD>, [Player] the noise stops.  Relax and turn back to sit by the fire.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player looks out at the suddenly-quiet darkness beyond the camp.
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Owlbear cub and dog placed off-stage (can't be found via gameplay for the remainder of this night).

Text.Value: Best friends! It's nice to have company, while you're gone all day.
Are you two... friends?

EditorData.stateContext: Player is in the corner of the campsite, away from tents and campfire. Scratch and the owlbear cub are standing.

Text.Value: Wait - did you say you have a brother?
Hold Scratch's gaze and incline your head towards the cub - everything all right?

EditorData.AnimationTags: <ChadD>[Player] pets the owlbears head on his left with his left hand.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Owlbear cub receives pets with a happy hoot.

Text.Value: I... I suppose I did. You've been good to us - to both of us. Gomwick would be happy I'm with you, I think.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little surprised himself (to have called the player master)

Text.Value: *Nothing. Both animals look fine, watching you expectantly.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player looks over the two animals (who're standing up) briefly.
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Cannot be jumped/aliased due to diffferent state from earlier version

Text.Value: Used to. Mother ate him.
Well, you're both welcome here.

EditorData.AnimationTags: <ChadD>[Player] comes to a sudden hault, panting before going to normal idle.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player arrives at the source of the noise and holds up.Reveal of the owlbear cub and Scratch lying together. The cub is asleep and having a bad dream. He growls and hoots aggressively in his sleep while Scratch lies next to him and howls softly to comfort the cub.
EditorData.SFXTags: SFX_Special  - Cub having a nightmare, Dog hooting softly to calm him

Text.Value: Thank you.

EditorData.SFXTags: SFX_Special  - Cub and Dog react to pets

Text.Value: All right then, so long as nobody's getting hurt.
Leave.
Pet the owlbear cub.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This node if the player hasn't petted the cub before (comapnion approval)

Text.Value: Hurry towards the sound.

EditorData.stateContext: Player is in the corner of the campsite, away from tents and campfire. Scratch and the owlbear cub are standing.

Text.Value: Observe the pair for any signs of injury.

EditorData.AnimationTags: <ChadD> [Player] pets Scratch's head on his right with his right hand.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Scratch receives pets with enthusiasm. The cub looks up at the player expectantly.

Text.Value: We will!
Hush now, it was just a nightmare. We're safe here, with master.
Hush now, it was just a nightmare. We're safe here, with mistress.
Hush now, it was just a nightmare. We're safe here, with our guardian.
He'll settle in. Give it a little time.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the player, referring to the owlbear cub

Text.Value: All right, keep it down. Folk are trying to rest.
*Nothing. Both animals look fine.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player looks over the two animals (who're lying down) briefly.

Text.Value: Pet the owlbear cub.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This node if the player has petted the cub before (no companion approval)

Synopsis:
The player hears an uproar in the camp and  think the owlbear’s turned on Scratch. When they investigate, they discover the cub is having a nightmare and the dog is comforting him. The player can talk to them and confirm that there's no danger. Subsequently, the cub will be a permanent feature in the camp, with new behaviours with Scratch, plus a new default dialogue.
Note: if the player decides to not investigate the sounds, the animals will be moved off-stage for the remainder of the night/the sounds will stop, The player won't know what happened until they see the animals again. If they have SwA, they can learn that there was nothing wrong.
